    • createConnection

      private static void createConnection()

    • createStatement

      private static PreparedStatement createStatement(String query)
      Generates a PreparedStatement object that embodies a SQL query and can then be executed on database for which connection already exists.
      Parameters:
      query - SQL query to be run on database.
      Returns:
      object that can then be executedo n database.

    • QueryFormat

      private static String QueryFormat(Object[] vals, boolean quotes)
      outputs the list of objects in a format required for SQL queries. If quotes == False then the output would look like (vals[0], vals[1], vals[2], ..., vals[n]) else the output would look like ('vals[0]', 'vals[1]', 'vals[2]', ..., 'vals[n]').
      Parameters:
      vals - values that need to be processed.
      quotes - Whether or not you want quotes surrounding each object in the list.
      Returns:
      Return formatted String

    • isValue

      static boolean isValue(String tableName, String fieldName, String value)
      Checks to see if there is a record in database where value == record[fieldName].
      Parameters:
      tableName - Table in the database which needs to be checked.
      fieldName - The field that value is searched against.
      value - The value compared against each record.
      Returns:
      Whether or not record is found.

    • getValue

      static HashMap<String,String> getValue(String tableName, String fieldName, String value)
      Retrieves a value from the database.
      Parameters:
      tableName - Table in the database which needs to be checked.
      fieldName - the field that value is searched against.
      value - Value that is compared against each record.
      Returns:
      desired database value, null if nothing is found.

    • getNValues

      static ArrayList<HashMap<String,String>> getNValues(String tableName, String fieldName, String value, int n)
      Retrives n values from the database.
      Parameters:
      tableName - table in the database to check.
      fieldName - Field in which to search for the value
      value - Value to look for.
      n - Number of values wanted.
      Returns:
      List of matches found to value.

    • addValue

      static boolean addValue(String tableName, HashMap<String,String> record)
      Adds a value to a table
      Parameters:
      tableName - Table in the database to add the value to.
      record - Hashmap containing record to add. Keys represent the fields.
      Returns:
      True if successfully added, false if not.

    • addNValues

      static boolean[] addNValues(String tableName, ArrayList<HashMap<String,String>> records, int n)
      Adds n values to a given database table.
      Parameters:
      tableName - Table to add values to.
      records - The values to add. Keys represent the fields.
      n - Number of values to be added.
      Returns:
      Array of true or false depending on successful or unsuccessful addition.

    • tableView

      static String[][] tableView(String tableName)
      Views a table given the name of the database table.
      Parameters:
      tableName - Table to view.
      Returns:
      Runs the query that returns the database table.

    • salesView

      static String[][] salesView(String date1, String date2)
      Given a time window, displays the sales by item from the order history.
      Parameters:
      date1 - Starting date.
      date2 - End date.
      Returns:
      Runs the query that returns the database table that displays the sales in a certain time.

    • excessView

      static String[][] excessView(String date1, String date2)
      Given a timestamp, displays the list of items that only sold less than 10% of their inventory between the timestamp and the current time. This assumes that no restocks have been done during that time.
      Returns:
      a 2D list of Strings containing the name, category, quantity, and units of any items stored in excess

    • loadRemaining

      static HashMap<String,Double> loadRemaining()
      Displays the list of items that have less than 10% of their original stock remaining in the store inventory. Assumes no restocks have been done since the initial inventory was populated.
      Returns:
      a 2D list of Strings containing the name, category, quantity, and units of any items that need to be restocked

    • restockView

      static String[][] restockView()

    • runQuery

      static ResultSet runQuery(String sqlQuery)
      Runs query for which on existing function does not exist.
      Parameters:
      sqlQuery - The query to use as a string.
      Returns:
      object the contains the result of running the query.

    • getSize

      static int getSize(String tableName)
      Returns the size of the specified SQL table
      Parameters:
      tableName - the name to SQL table we want the size of
      Returns:
      the size of the SQL table named tableName

    • editTable

      static boolean editTable(String tableName, int row, int col, String colName, Object data)
      Updates the specified table at the specified row and column with a specified value.
      Parameters:
      tableName - the name of the table to update
      row - the row number of the table to update
      col - the column number the table to update
      colName - the name of the column of the cell that needs to be updated
      data - the data to put in the table at the specified row and column
      Returns:
      whether or not the table was successfully updated

    • removeRecord

      static void removeRecord(String tableName, int row)
      Removes a row from the specified table. Used when removing items from the inventory or menu.
      Parameters:
      tableName - the name of the table from which to remove a row
      row - the row number to remove from the table

    • addEmptyCell

      static void addEmptyCell(String tableName)
      Adds an empty row to the specified SQL table
      Parameters:
      tableName - the table to which to add the new row

    • depleteInventory

      static void depleteInventory(String ingredient, Double qty)
      Helper function for updateInventoryFromOrder. Depletes a specified amount of the given ingredient from the store inventory.
      Parameters:
      ingredient - the ingredient to deplete stock from
      qty - the amount of the ingredient to deplete from the inventory

    • updateInventoryFromOrder

      static void updateInventoryFromOrder(String order)
      Primary function for depleting inventory based on a customer order. Looks at the customer order to determine the menu items ordered, then maps to menu table to decide how much of which ingredients to deplete from the store inventory. Calls depleteInventory on each ingredient used up by the order.
      Parameters:
      order - the customer's order, specifying the specific menu items they chose.

    • invDepletionInitial

      static void invDepletionInitial()
      Looks at all of the past orders (orders that initially populate the database) and depletes the base inventory. This is what creates the "original inventory" used to calculate excess and restock reports. Only called when setting up the database for the first time.

    • menuItemIngredients

      static HashMap<String,Double> menuItemIngredients(String menuItem)
      Helper function used in inventory depletion. Given a menu item, returns a list of ingredients used to create that menu item.
      Parameters:
      menuItem - the menu item for which to return ingredients
      Returns:
      a HashMap of ingredients used to create the given menu item, along with amounts of each ingredient used

    • dropTable

      public static void dropTable(String tableName)
      Drops the specified table from the SQL database. Called in the useDatabase.java file, during database population.
      Parameters:
      tableName - the name of the table to drop

    • createTable

      public static void createTable(String tableName)
      Called in the useDatabase file to populate the SQL database. Creates a table in the database with the given name.
      Parameters:
      tableName - the name of the table to create
